# Motivation 

  - *Proof-Based Math Readings* is an independent online reading group where we study mathematics required in economics master's/PhD programs using an intuitive approach.
  - This session of the reading group is on *Real Analysis*.

# Prerequisites

  - CGPA: 3.00/4.00 and **Book of Proof - Richard Hammack (3.3 Edition, 2022)**.
  - Please apply by uploading your CV and transcript to this [\faLink Google Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeD7asHGf1_mFrMCPZRgsQplnrYfBD0Y5XVOS-q-mVe7slDhg/viewform) until 23:59, 28 July 2023.  
    Please upload your CV and transcript as **NameSurname.pdf**, not **CV.pdf**.  
    Students who applied will be informed about their application results via email at 10:00, 30 July 2023.

# Format

  - This session will last 12 weeks from 31 July 2023 to 22 October 2023.
  - We will discuss the topics/exercises that we struggle with at [\faDiscord Proof-Based Math Readings \[Discord\]](https://discord.com/).
  - We will not have face-to-face/online meetings due to size of the group.
  - Members are expected to read the chapters, and watch the chapter videos from the book's playlist.

# Resources [All are open-access]

## Main Book and Main Book's Playlist

**Basic Analysis: I Introduction to Real Analysis [Volume I]** by Jiri Lebl is our main book for this session because it is well-written, well-structured, and open-access. \newline
Casey Rodriguez's playlist is our main playlist because his narrative is just great.

\begin{itemize}
  \item[\faBook] \href{https://www.jirka.org/ra}{Basic Analysis I: Introduction to Real Analysis [Volume I] - Jiri Lebl (Version 6.0, 2023)}
  \item[\faYoutube] \href{https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLUl4u3cNGP61O7HkcF7UImpM0cR_L2gSw}{Real Analysis - Casey Rodriguez (2020, Companion playlist to the main book)}

\end{itemize}
